thread.title: Baby orangutan saved from a life in captivity | Meridian
thread.title_full: Baby orangutan saved from a life in captivity | Meridian - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Baby orangutan saved from a life in captivity | Meridian
text:
Rescuers in Borneo saved the baby orangutan from captivity Credit: International Animal Rescue An international animal rescue charity based in Sussex has helped rescue a baby orangutan in Borneo.
The orangutan, was being kept illegally as a family pet.
Thanks to a tip off, the team travelled to a village in Ketapang, where they found the seven months old female, named Vena with her owner.
Despite, rules against owning an orangutan in Indonesia, it is still common for people to keep them as pets.
Last year 2016 the team rescued 12 orangutans from captivity. This year they have already saved three so far.
It's high time people realised that, if they keep breaking the law by capturing orangutans and keeping or selling them as pets, then the species will soon become extinct.
– Karmele Llano Sanchez, Programme Director for IAR in Indonesia, Vena the orangutan was found in a village in Ketapang Credit: International Animal Rescue Vena is now being looked after at the Orangutan Conservation Centre in Ketapang.
She will eventually be introduced to some other babies and begin her rehabilitation.
Last updated Thu 23 Feb 2017 Sussex
